description: This course introduces students to the complexities of international dispute resolution. Students meet with leading figures in international law at some of the most important venues for resolving conflicts among states. Students gain a general understanding of the complex institutional mechanisms that have been created to ensure the security and improve the welfare of states as well as the international courts created to prosecute international crimes and promote human rights. Offered periodically during January term.
name: World Courts in Europe
notes: This is a study abroad course. You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad
